result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Cohen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
with Huber privileges.   IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.
-------------------------
Defendant may transfer supervision to Illinois where he resides.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs. Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim.
-------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
-------------------------
Restitution in the amount of $1,851.42 has been paid in full.

Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Daniel J Cohen in court with attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec Iii.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared with Andrew Herrmann (Intern) for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

936 am case called. Appearances made. 
Attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec Iii appeared.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Kmiec requests today's hearing be rescheduled as Mr. Cohen is ill. He indicates preliminary hearing will be waived. No objection by Atty Powell. 
Court continues hearing as requested. 
937 am court in recess.  Status conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH N.R..   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Daniel J Cohen in court with attorney Kevin Noonan for Theodore Bernard Kmiec Iii.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
